Mary mauriello went to work as a
caregiver at OD HEC Developmental Center
a state-run institution for adults with
severe autism not long after she started
she began to witness a disturbing
pattern of abuse of residents by other
caregivers she said that on repeated
occasions aides forced one young man to
stay on a padded mat for hours on end
when he would try to crawl off the mat
or walk off the mat or when he would act
out in any way they would hit him with a
stick a blue stick it was like a child's
instrument my saw somebody step on his
hands before to tell him to get back on
the mat I saw somebody bend his fingers
back if he threw his play fading freedom
he weighed 87 pounds give me a break
I mean you can't put two and two
together miss mauriello secretly
recorded a meeting with her superiors
detailing the abuse she witnessed I just
went through you know my whole my whole
story that I've seen you know abuse I've
seen physical verbal you know all that
all this abuse
you know these individuals are people I
don't understand you know how how you
can allow this to go on and and and just
say everything that I said is
unsubstantiated it was like it just fell
on deaf ears again she says that she
made the decision to record the
interview out of frustration and in an

be done to stop the abuse it's it an

not seeing it I could answer that

heck there was one woman that lives
there and she has a compulsion over

the hamburger and saying do you want
this we can't have it you want it we can
have it and she was getting you know
visibly upset over it and then they went
on to throw french fries on the floor
and have the consumers go and eat the
french fries off the floor and when I
asked them what they were doing the
response of one of the direct aides was
we're playing fetch and they both
started laughing the experience haunted
Miss mauriello who sought out the work
because her son has a developmental
disability it affected me greatly I
would just think of my own child and you
know god forbid he ever ended up in a in
a place like that I was told during one
of my first few days on the job that I
would do fine if I kept my eyes open in

leave and I wanted to but I also
couldn't afford to just walk out of a
state job after multiple meetings and

she grew frustrated by the lack of
responsiveness on the part of her bosses
I just feel that this is being taken
very lightly and
your explanation I'm just telling you

and put some very immediate protections

that this was not at all thinking lately

miss mauriello decided to go to the

heck citing an open investigation the
office for people with developmental
disabilities declined to share any
information about the case when the
state was informed that the times was in
possession of Miss Morales tape the two
superiors that she recorded were removed
from their positions and reassigned Ms
mauriello no longer works for the state
she is now providing private hospice
care and studying to become a nurse
my regret from this is is that I didn't
